definitions: added to something already present or available as extra or supplementary
examples: We need additional funds to complete the project
The teacher provided additional resources for interested students

definitions: having many intricate parts or aspects that make understanding difficult
taking part in an activity or being included in something
examples: The instructions were too involved for beginners to follow
This math problem is more involved than it first appears
She's deeply involved in community service projects
All team members should be involved in decision-making

definitions: feeling worry or anxiety about something that might happen or has happened
having a connection with or responsibility for something being discussed
examples: Parents are concerned about their children's online safety
The doctor seemed concerned about the test results
All concerned parties must sign the agreement today
The department concerned with public safety issued new guidelines

definitions: inspiring delight, pleasure, or admiration through being extremely good or remarkable
examples: We had a wonderful time at the beach yesterday
She has a wonderful talent for making people laugh

definitions: of, relating to, or professing Christianity or its teachings and beliefs
examples: Many christian holidays are celebrated around the world
The church follows traditional christian values and practices

definitions: having the same characteristics or qualities as something else
examples: The twins wear like outfits to school everyday
We need to find like minded people for our team

definitions: causing great surprise or wonder through being unexpected or hard to believe
extremely impressive or excellent in quality, skill, or achievement
examples: The magician performed an amazing trick with cards
It's amazing how quickly children learn new languages
The view from the mountain top was absolutely amazing
She has an amazing ability to remember names

definitions: having life, not dead or inanimate, continuing to live and breathe
full of energy, activity, or excitement that makes something vibrant
examples: The plant is still alive despite the harsh winter
Doctors worked hard to keep the patient alive
The city comes alive during the summer festival season
Her eyes were alive with curiosity and wonder

definitions: having good health and free from illness or disease
promoting good health or contributing to physical and mental wellbeing
examples: Regular exercise helps you stay healthy and strong
The doctor said the baby is perfectly healthy
Eating vegetables is part of a healthy lifestyle
They maintain a healthy balance between work and relaxation

definitions: connected with or engaged in commerce and business activities
intended to make a profit rather than for private or artistic purposes
examples: The building is zoned for commercial use only
Several commercial airlines fly this route daily
The movie was a huge commercial success worldwide
They rejected the commercial offer from the sponsor

definitions: having no one else present, being by oneself without companionship
examples: She prefers to work alone in her office
The child was afraid to sleep alone at night

definitions: having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar or honey
having or showing a kind and gentle nature towards others
pleasing in general through being charming, delightful, or endearing
examples: The orange juice is too sweet for my taste
Children love sweet treats like candy and cookies
She has such a sweet personality that everyone loves
It was sweet of you to remember my birthday
The baby made the sweetest sounds while sleeping
What a sweet little cottage by the lake

definitions: affected by physical or mental illness and not in good health
feeling as if you might vomit due to stomach upset
thoroughly tired of or disgusted by something from having too much
examples: The sick child stayed home from school today
She's been sick with the flu all week
The boat ride made several passengers feel sick
I felt sick after eating too much candy
I'm sick of hearing the same excuses everyday
Everyone's sick of the constant rain this month

definitions: having qualities that are typical of most people or things
calculated by adding quantities together and dividing by their number
examples: The average student takes four years to graduate
It was just an average day with nothing special
The average temperature this month is seventy degrees
We need to calculate the average of these test scores

definitions: having or showing a great lack of intelligence or common sense
irritating or annoying through being pointless, unreasonable, or lacking sense
examples: It was stupid to go out without an umbrella
Don't make stupid mistakes by not checking your work
This stupid computer keeps freezing every five minutes
We had a stupid argument about nothing important

definitions: of or relating to China, its people, language, or culture
examples: She's learning to speak chinese at the university
We ordered chinese food for dinner last night

definitions: having an obligation to do something or being accountable for one's actions
able to be trusted to do what is right or needed
examples: Parents are responsible for their children's safety and wellbeing
The manager is responsible for all department decisions
She's very responsible and always completes tasks on time
We need a responsible person to watch the house

definitions: having or showing quick intelligence and mental alertness
clean, tidy, and stylish in appearance or dress
quick, brisk, and often painful in physical impact
examples: She's smart enough to solve complex problems quickly
The smart students finished the test early
He looked very smart in his new business suit
The restaurant has a smart, modern interior design
The ball hit him with a smart blow to the head
She gave him a smart tap on the shoulder

definitions: situated in, directed toward, or coming from the south direction
examples: The southern states have warmer weather year round
We traveled to the southern part of France

definitions: situated in, directed toward, or coming from the west direction
relating to cowboys and the American Old West genre
examples: Western europe includes countries like France and Spain
The sun sets in the western sky each evening
He loves watching old western movies on weekends
The bar had a western theme with cowboy decorations

definitions: of or relating to Great Britain, its people, or culture
examples: She speaks with a distinctive british accent
British weather is known for being rainy and cloudy

definitions: coming after something in time, place, or order
about to be mentioned or listed next in sequence
examples: The days following the storm were sunny and calm
She was exhausted following the long journey home
Please answer the following questions on the form
The following students should report to the office

definitions: having all necessary or normal parts, components, or steps
to the greatest extent or degree possible, total or absolute
examples: Make sure you have a complete set of tools
The complete works of Shakespeare fill many volumes
The project was a complete success beyond expectations
There was complete silence in the empty house

definitions: providing entertainment, amusement, or enjoyment that creates pleasure
examples: The birthday party was really fun for everyone
Swimming at the beach is a fun summer activity

definitions: existing or occurring now at this time rather than past or future
being in a particular place rather than elsewhere or absent
examples: We must focus on present circumstances not past mistakes
The present situation requires immediate action
All students must be present for the final exam
Several celebrities were present at the charity event

definitions: existing in fact or reality, not imagined, supposed, or pretended
examples: The actual cost was higher than the estimate
What's the actual reason you called me today?

definitions: expressing or containing denial, refusal, or the opposite meaning
harmful, unpleasant, or not constructive in effect or outcome
less than zero in mathematical value or electrical charge
examples: She gave a negative response to the invitation
The test came back negative for any infections
Constant criticism has a negative effect on children
Try to avoid negative thoughts about yourself
The temperature dropped to negative ten degrees last night
A negative number multiplied by positive gives negative result

definitions: following or arranged in a fixed, uniform, or predictable pattern
usual, customary, or normal in occurrence, practice, or appearance
examples: The train runs on a regular schedule every hour
She maintains regular exercise habits for good health
He's a regular customer at the coffee shop
This is just a regular day at the office

definitions: able or likely to cause harm, injury, or adverse effects
examples: Swimming in the ocean during a storm is dangerous
Keep dangerous chemicals away from children and pets

definitions: preferred before all others of the same kind or regarded with special favor
examples: Chocolate ice cream is my favorite dessert
She's the teacher's favorite student in the class

definitions: free from outside control and not depending on another's authority
not depending on another for livelihood, support, or subsistence
examples: The country became independent after years of colonial rule
She values her independent lifestyle and decision making
He's financially independent and doesn't need help from family
The store is an independent business not a chain

definitions: of, at, or in the position that faces forward or is most prominent
examples: Please sit in the front row of the classroom
The front door needs to be painted this weekend

definitions: connected to, served by, or available through the internet or computer network
examples: Many people prefer online shopping to visiting stores
The online course starts next Monday morning

definitions: having knowledge or perception of a situation, fact, or feeling
examples: Are you aware of the new company policies?
She became aware of someone following her home

definitions: added to an existing or usual amount, number, or degree
examples: Would you like extra cheese on your pizza?
The teacher gave extra homework over the weekend

definitions: of little weight and easy to lift, carry, or move
pale in color or having little color saturation
not serious or profound but rather amusing or entertaining
examples: This suitcase is light enough to carry upstairs
She prefers light fabrics for summer clothing
The walls are painted in a light blue color
Her hair turned light brown in the summer sun
We had some light conversation during dinner
It's just light reading for the beach vacation

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of Europe or its peoples
examples: Many european countries use the euro as currency
She studied european history at the university

definitions: having or involving several parts, elements, or members in number
examples: The accident involved multiple vehicles on the highway
She holds multiple degrees from different universities

definitions: living or growing in natural conditions and not domesticated or cultivated
uncontrolled, unrestrained, or extreme in behavior, emotion, or appearance
examples: Wild animals should be observed from a safe distance
They picked wild berries growing along the trail
The crowd went wild when their team scored
She had wild curly hair that couldn't be tamed

definitions: of, relating to, or befitting a president or presidency
examples: The presidential election takes place every four years
Security was tight during the presidential visit

definitions: done, happening, or produced every day or each weekday
examples: Taking vitamins is part of her daily routine
The newspaper provides daily updates on current events

definitions: of or relating to women, girls, or the sex that produces eggs
examples: The female students outnumber males in this program
Many female athletes compete at the professional level

definitions: having or giving off a moderate degree of heat
showing enthusiasm, affection, or kindness in manner or personality
examples: The soup is still warm from the stove
Pack warm clothes for the mountain trip
She gave him a warm welcome at the door
The host had a warm, friendly personality

definitions: free from dirt, stains, or harmful substances
morally uncontaminated or pure, not involving illegality
smoothly skillful and without flaws in execution or form
examples: Make sure your hands are clean before eating
The kitchen was spotlessly clean after scrubbing
He has a clean criminal record with no arrests
The company maintains clean business practices
The gymnast made a clean landing after the jump
It was a clean hit in the baseball game

definitions: very small in size, amount, or degree
examples: The baby bird was tiny enough to fit in your palm
She lives in a tiny apartment downtown

definitions: of, relating to, or existing in the mind or intellect
examples: Chess requires strong mental abilities and concentration
Mental health is as important as physical health

definitions: feeling pleasure, joy, or delight about something that happened
examples: I'm glad you could come to the party
She was glad to hear the good news

definitions: making little or no noise or sound
free from disturbance, activity, or excitement, peaceful and calm
examples: Please be quiet while the baby is sleeping
The library is a quiet place for studying
We spent a quiet evening at home reading
After retirement, they lived a quiet life in the country

definitions: giving out or reflecting much light that illuminates surroundings
showing intelligence and mental alertness with quick understanding of things
having strong, intense, or vivid color that catches attention
examples: The bright sun made it hard to see
We need bright lights for the photography studio
She's a bright student who learns concepts quickly
His bright ideas helped solve the company's problems
The artist used bright yellows and oranges in painting
Children often prefer bright colors to dull ones

definitions: occurring once every year at the same time or season
examples: The company holds its annual meeting in January
We take an annual vacation to the mountains
